bytecode

Class VIRTUALCALL

  • java.lang.Object
    • bytecode.Bytecode
      • bytecode.NonBranchingBytecode
        • bytecode.SequentialBytecode
          • bytecode.CALL
            • bytecode.VIRTUALCALL

  • public class VIRTUALCALL
extends CALL
    A bytecode that calls a method of an object with dynamic lookup. That object is the receiver of the call. If the receiver is nil, the computation stops.

    ..., receiver, par_1, ..., par_n -> ..., returned value
    if the method return type is non-void

    ..., receiver, par_1, ..., par_n -> ...
    if the method's return type is void
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

      Constructs a bytecode that calls a method of an object with dynamic lookup.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VIRTUALCALL

        public VIRTUALCALL(ClassType receiverType,
                   MethodSignature staticTarget)
        Constructs a bytecode that calls a method of an object with dynamic lookup. The set of runtime targets is assumed to be that obtained from every subclass of the static type of the receiver.
        Parameters:
        receiverType - the static type of the receiver of this call
        staticTarget - the signature of the static target of the call

    • Method Detail

      • generateJavaBytecode

        public org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionList generateJavaBytecode(JavaClassGenerator classGen)
        Generates the Java bytecode corresponding to this Kitten bytecode. Namely, it generates an invokevirtual staticTarget Java bytecode. The Java invokevirtual bytecode calls a method by using the runtime class of the receiver to look up for the method's implementation.
        Specified by:
        generateJavaBytecode in class NonBranchingBytecode
        Parameters:
        classGen - the Java class generator to be used for this generation
        Returns:
        the Java invokevirtual staticTarget bytecode
